snippet: A device that measures leaked methane may greatly underestimate it, says an inventor of the technology used in the device, possibly affecting climate change predictions.
abstract: Study published by Touche Howard in Journal Energy Science & Engineering claims that device he invented that is widely used to measure methane leaks from industrial processes may be greatly underestimating volume of emissions; findings could have profound consequences for natural gas supply chain and alter predictions about severity of climate change, as methane is potent greenhouse gas.
lead_paragraph: A device that measures leaked methane may greatly underestimate it, says an inventor of the technology used in the device, possibly affecting climate change predictions.

headline.main: Methane Leaks May Greatly Exceed Estimates, Report Says
headline.print_headline: New Study Challenges Methane Leak Estimates
